TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit HueOffset extends DocumentFormat.OpenXml.OpenXmlLeafElement

summary.para: This class is available in Office 2007 and above.
When the object is serialized out as xml, it's qualified name is a:hueOff.

remarks.format:
## Remarks [!INCLUDE[openxmlnoticeiso](~/includes/openxmlnoticeiso.md)]
**hueOff (Hue Offset)**
This element specifies the input color with its hue shifted, but with its saturation and luminance unchanged.
|Parent Elements| |---------------------| |hslClr (§20.1.2.3.13); prstClr (§20.1.2.3.22); schemeClr (§20.1.2.3.29); scrgbClr (§20.1.2.3.30); srgbClr (§20.1.2.3.32); sysClr (§20.1.2.3.33)|
[*Note*: The W3C XML Schema definition of this element’s content model (CT_Angle) is located in §A.4.1. *end note*]
[!INCLUDE[openxmlnoticeiso](~/includes/openxmlcopyrightiso.md)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the HueOffset class.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.Val : DocumentFormat.OpenXml.Int32Value with get, set

summary.para: Represents the following attribute in the schema: val

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following information from the ECMA International [Standard ECMA-376](http://www.ecma-international.org/publications/standards/Ecma-376.htm) can be useful when working with this class.
Specifies the actual angular value of the shift. The result of the shift must be between 0 and 360 degrees. Shifts resulting in angular values less than 0 will be treated as 0. Shifts resulting in angular values greater than 360 will be treated as 360.
The following increases the hue angular value by 10 degrees.
``` <a:solidFill> <a:hslClr hue="0" sat="100000" lum="50000"/> <a:hueOff val="600000"/> </a:solidFill> ```
The possible values for this attribute are defined by the `ST_Angle` simple type.
